intro: Mesembryanthemum viridicatum, commonly known as the green-flowered ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, often blue or greenish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically succulent, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. It is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
